about.title: About
about.description: My name is Roman Pella, I live in Russia and work as a front-end developer. My career has been characterised by continuous professional growth and the successful implementation of a number of projects. Some of my achievements are listed below.
about.subHeader: I am an experienced front-end developer with expertise in modern web technologies. I have a strong understanding of web development principles and best practices, and I strive to create high-quality, user-friendly web applications.

skills.title: Skills
skills.subtitle: Basic:
skills.description: I am involved in creating information systems in the field of information security. I have experience developing administrative panels for large products on React, as well as experience leading a development team and mentoring.

resume.title: Resume
resume.description: I am seeking a position as a middle+ or senior front-end developer. I am always open to new opportunities and am ready to improve my skills and put them into practice. I am prepared to take on responsibility for complex tasks and contribute to the creation of high-quality products.

sumary.title: Sumary
sumary.subTitle: Roman Pellya
sumary.description: I easily establish contact and build productive relationships with colleagues and partners. I analyse problems in depth and find solutions even when resources or deadlines are limited. I meet deadlines precisely thanks to detailed planning and prioritisation of tasks, and I complete them responsibly. I see complex projects as a challenge for professional growth! I constantly study modern tools and optimise processes.

experience.title: Professional Experience
experience.subTitle: Frontend developer
experience.description: Development of SPA applications for administrative panels in the field of information security. Technologies: React.js, JS, TS, HTML, Styles Components, SCSS, Redux Toolkit, Webpack, Vite, Ant design, Jest, React Testing Library, StoryBook, Git.

labels.0: Creating and maintaining high-load administrative panels for managing large products from scratch.
labels.1: Configuring Webpack and Vite build tools, testing environments, ESLint, StyleLint, and Prettier linters.
labels.2: Designing business logic and application architecture.
labels.3: Implementation of business logic using RTK Query.
labels.4: Development of various modules and components: a separate UI library for each project, user registration and authorisation using JWT tokens, employee identification.
labels.5: Project optimisation. During refactoring, I used lazy loading of components and translations, which increased the application's speed by 30% and reduced build time by 40% through assembler configuration.
labels.6: Building large SVG graphics and updating them every second without memory leakage.
labels.7: Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior developers.
labels.8: Implementation of best practices (code style, typing, documentation of field requirements).
labels.9: Achieving 80% code coverage for critical modules.
labels.10: Setting up unit tests (Jest, React Testing Library) and StoryBook for UI libraries.
labels.11: Participated in 3 large and challenging projects on React.ts.
